docs.title: Rise and shine. Mr. Freeman. Rise. And. Shine.
docs.text: This project is a fork of the original g_man bot. (https://github.com/nkrasn/g_man) So credits to nkrasn for making this bot.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Slash commands with user install support.
  • Simple media editing commands.
  • A block/allowlisting system along with bot owners being able to globally block users or servers.
  • A command block/allowlisting system that works similar to the block and allowlist system.
  • Many information commands.
  • Such as userinfo, channelinfo, and serverinfo (there's more of course.)
  • A reminder system.
  • A YouTube search command.
  • Music commands with FFMPEG audio filters support along with a queue system.
  • A prefix changing system.
  • An AI chatbot command via Ollama that supports executing TagScript.
  • Code execution server and command that includes custom packages like yt-dlp, ffmpeg, etc.
  • And lastly, a tag system with tagscripting support.

docs.title: Usage/Commands
docs.text: You can now just type g-help in a channel to see all the commands.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• The FFMPEG binary/executable, and YT-DLP package from pip (remember, not the executable for yt-dlp)
  • Ollama
  • Docker
  • A PostgreSQL database
  • see the setup.sql file and run the query. This is required for the prefix, command/bot block/allowlisting system, reminder system, and tags.
  • All the Python packages in requirements.txt

You can install the Python packages, preferably in a virtual environment, by running

pip install -r requirements.txt

Tip: If you're using Mac or Linux, you may have Python 2/Pip 2 preinstalled. You should run:

pip3 install -r requirements.txt

If the pip installation didn't work, try to install the packages seperately because I suck at finding a good compatible version for the requirements.txt file.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• Download/install all requirements.
  • Set up these folders with the following contents (if a folder doesn't exist, create it):
  • vids
    • Keep this folder empty as its contents are often deleted.
  • Create a copy of bot_info_template.json and rename it to bot_info.json. Fill it in with the appropriate information (keep the quotes).
  • Go to the g-coder directory and run docker-compose up -d --build to set up the code execution server.
  • Code execution server's port is 8000.
  • Run py gman.py (or if you are on Linux/macOS, python3 gman.py)

docs.title: Terms of Service & Privacy Policy
docs.text: You must follow our ToS and Privacy Policy in order to use the public version of G-Man. Please keep in mind I am a normal human being and that I can make mistakes. I have a life.

docs.title: Terms of Service
docs.text:
• Do not use G-Man in order to violate the public laws or Terms of Service/Privacy Policy of Discord or any other services.
  • Additionally, do not use G-Man in order to download or share media that is DRM-protected/illegal.
  • Also includes violating any other country laws including Türkiye.
  • Along with the ai command.
  • I reserve the right to terminate your usage of G-Man for any reason, any time, any where.
  • You may not use G-Man in order to target an individual or groups of individuals.
  • You may not use G-Man if you are under the age of 13. Though it may depend on your country's laws in order to use Discord, so it can be higher than just 13.

docs.title: "We" refers to myself, because I am the only one working for this bot.
docs.text:
• We do not use your personal information whatsoever.
  • We log command usage to our local database. This is used for the commandusage command to help in moderation regarding potential bad actors. If you want your data removed from this, you'll have to contact me in discord at my support server. (my username is miniatureege2006)
  • Additionally, the command content will be included anytime you or anyone uses any commands. This is for moderation and monitoring purposes, along with debugging.
  • We do NOT share these data with anyone at all.
  • I am not responsible/liable for any media/content that is created from other users using G-Man.
  • If you wish to opt-out of using G-Man and want your data removed completely, contact me in discord at my support server and I will handle it.

docs.title: Main commands
docs.text:
This category consists of important commands for the bot.

  • ping -> Check the bot's latency.
  • sudo -> Execute a command as another user. Use sudo! to bypass checks and permissions.
  • eval -> Evaluate code.
  • addguildprefix -> Add a guild prefix for the current guild.
  • removeguildprefix -> Remove a guild prefix.
  • listguildprefixes -> List the guild prefixes.
  • addpersonalprefix -> Add a personal prefix for yourself.
  • removepersonalprefix -> Remove a personal prefix that you made.
  • listpersonalprefixes -> List your personal prefixes.
  • command -> Enable or disable a command.
  • commandclear -> Clear all command permissions for a command.
  • commandlist -> List all command permissions.
  • commandusage -> View command usage history.
  • allow -> Allows a user, channel, or role to use the bot.
  • allowlist -> List all allowed users, channels, and roles.
  • deny -> Denies a user, channel, or role from using the bot. (Not to be confused with block.)
  • block -> Blocks a user, channel, or role from using the bot.
  • blocklist -> List all blocked users, channels, and roles.
  • unblock -> Unblocks a user, channel, or role from using the bot.
  • reload -> Reloads extensions.
  • sync -> Sync slash commands.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Add a guild prefix for the current guild.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Allows a user, channel, or role to use the bot.

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-allow user miniatureege2006 this user is important.
g-allow channel bot-commands this channel is the bot commands channel, use commands here.
g-allow role Admin to prevent abuse.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: List all allowed users, channels, and roles.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Block a user, channel, or role from using the bot.

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-block user miniatureege2006 abusing.
g-block channel general not a bot commands channel.
g-block role Member not trusted.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: List all blocked users, channels, and roles.

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-command ai server deny no ai allowed.
g-command tag channel general allow tags should be used here.
g-command tag channel reset

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Clear all command permissions for a command.

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-commandclear ai user
g-commandclear tag channel
g-commandclear ping role

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-commandusage ping
g-commandusage ping miniatureege2006
/commandusage command:ai limit:25

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Denies a user, channel, or role from using the bot. (Not to be confused with block.)

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-deny user miniatureege2006
g-deny channel bot-commands
g-deny role Admin

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Remove a personal prefix that you made.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Execute a command as another user. Use sudo! to bypass checks and permissions.

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-sudo someuser ping
g-sudo someuser help sudo

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Unblocks a user, channel, or role from using the bot.

docs.title: Examples:
docs.text:
g-unblock user miniatureege2006
g-unblock channel general
g-unblock role Member
